title-group.article-title: Forced and Directed Heat Exchange for Providing Human Body Comfort in Extreme Environments

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1998 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: A new methodological tool was developed consisting of a patchwork thermal cool/warm grid with great flexibility to manipulate the temperature on different areas of the body. Through conflicting temperatures on the body surface, it is possible to direct heat current to different distal or proximal areas. The effectiveness of the use of a cooled hood, gloves, socks on the overheated body was evaluated as countermeasures for balancing heat exchange. Temperature in the magistral vessels was the main source of information for understanding the mechanism of the relationship between core and shell, and shell and distal parts of the limb.
